Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: MultanRafique
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ibis Berlin Messe is located near International conference center and international Bus station.Comfortable clean rooms.Breakfast hall is located on the top of the hotel where you can have the panoramic view of the city. Free internet and WiFi facility in the reception lobby. No shopping mall or good restaurants nearby but metro station is few hundred meters from the hotel. Friendly helpful staff, always willing to help tourists plan their day trip.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but Sparse”
Reviews.Author: Evs_33 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well located for my purpose but the room was sparse. No Tea/Coffee facilities, TV only had 1 English speaking channel. Bed was ok but not the most comfortable room was cold. Expensive for what you got.

Reviews.Title: “One night in Ibis Berlin Messedamm”
Reviews.Author: Antriksh1987
Reviews.Content: Single guy ........travelling alone....looking to safe and economical place to stay? Ibis Messedamm is the place to stay ....but dont except too much. Positive Points:- Really friendly staff. Clean rooms. Not very expensive for a night. Really close to international bus station. (Useful if you are JAMES BOND and on mission...). U-bahn and S-bahn are really close. Negative points:- No wifi in room. Breakfast is in a place nearby (andy's dinner)...which is not really good.

Reviews.Title: “Better luck next time!”
Reviews.Author: Garnhuset Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Bed were too hard and no good chair in the room. Breakfast was in Andy´s next door - it was very kaotish! Too small for so many people. We have been in Ibis Messe Hotel 2 times before - it was better (fine) then!

Reviews.Title: “Substandard facilities and services”
Reviews.Author: Zoglets
Reviews.Content: This is one of the lowest reviews I have ever written for a Western chain hotel. Some of the lowlights I encountered: Showers functioned sporadically. Pressures were low sometimes and temperatures would not go too high. This is a problem I encounter in $10 hotels in the Third World, not in Berlin. Breakfast quality was low. The only item of hot food was scrambled eggs. Again, some of the lowest quality breakfast in a Western chain hotel I can remember. I would have gladly paid to eat at the next door American style diner but that was closed for breakfast. No safes in the rooms. You'd think that a hotel catering to business travellers would provide them in the rooms. All this and I paid EUR 109. Aside from that the fact I was charged for internet access was only a minor irritant. The site is very convenient for the Messe which is across the street and has good access to both the U-Bahn and the S-Bahn. There is a taxi rank next to the hotel as there is a long distance bus station there.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for meetings at the convention center”
Reviews.Author: haty
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ibis in September when I was in Berlin for a conference being held at the convention center directly across the street. I had my hesitations initially as I typically prefer to stay in 4+ star establishments especially when traveling in Europe but the Ibis was perfect. The room although small was clean and the service was friendly and accommodating. Breakfast was a bit expensive especially considering the the poor value of the USD but both the S and U-bahn were right outside the hotel door to make evening jaunts to downtown very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and without pretense”
Reviews.Author: dlwdlw Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Opposite the Messe building, with excellent public transport connections (road connections too). The heart of Charlottenburg is just three S-Bahn stops away (Savignyplatz) with many restaurants in the side streets. We arrived late and the receptionist was bored bordering on rude, but with a little tenacity we got all that we wanted (and what had been pre-arranged). The rooms are spacious and serve their purpose. The breakfast is well assorted and makes for a good start of the day.

Reviews.Title: “A sympathetic front desk”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived early on the bus from Copenhagen exhausted, and the front desk person gave us a much earlier checkin than she had to. For that we will definitely stay at Ibis again (I'd never heard of them previously).

Reviews.Title: “Functional, clean hotel with basic amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Pantilesdoctor
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for me by a company who organised my attendance at the adjacent ICC conference centre. Hence, the location was fine for me- also next to tube station and taxi rank so easy to get to city centre and the Tegel airport by taxi. In the room, bed and flatscreen TV were fine, with a good range of channels. No toiletries apart from universal shower/ handwash. Small shower space with good water pressure but high step into it. .I thought the extra 30 euros per person per night in the room was too high for absolutely nothing additional except breakfast for the person. Wi fi could be paid for as an extra. There were 2 free computers in the lobby. Staff were helpful and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Good for conference attendance”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Ibis Berlin Messe is an excellent hotel for anyone attending the Berlin Conference Centre (ICC), as I did. It is just across the road, connected by an under-road walkway, so there is no need to cross the busy Kantstrasse or Messedam roads. It is close to an S-Bahn station (Nord-ICC) and a U-Bahn station (Kaiserdam) which gives convenient access to the efficient Berlin transport system. I booked this hotel, not just because of its location, but because, as part of the Accor group, I could rely on a known level of standards, with which I have always been happy. The Ibis Messe fits well within these standards. The room was spacious enough, without being large. The bed was very comfortable and I had no trouble sleeping. There was no no noise apparent from my room on the 7th floor, but I was on the far side to the roads, so it is otherwise difficult to assess. Room amenities were basic, but adequate, as to be expected. There was no fridge or tea and coffee making facilities, but this was not important to me. The bathroom was functional, with a small shower, which was a little awkward to get into and out of, but water was hot and pressure was good. Drainage was a little slow, so the water built up at your feet by the end of the shower. This was only a minor quibble and was reported to the reception staff. The staff at reception were very helpful and had badges identifying which languages they speak, generally English and German, but other languages were also evident. They were most useful to me when I needed to get to locations across the city, and needed to navigate the various train changes. Breakfast was a very good cold collation of bread meats, dairy, fruit and cereals, which provided a good start to the day. There is Chinese restaurant on the first floor which serves large, excellent meals at a reasonable price. Highly recommended. The hotel may not be as convenient if you are in Berlin for sight-seeing, but, being near a station would mean that nothing is too far away in Berlin. Overall, a good stay which meets, and probably exceeds, my expectations of an Ibis Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: lundia
Reviews.Content: When you see this hotel for the 1st time, keep in mind : don't judge the book by its cover. The exterior looks like a cheesy cheap hotel, poor maintenance, filthy and slump. Surprisingly, it's very comfy inside. I believe this hotel has just been revamped recently. The layout inside the guest room is very nice and clean. The bathroom is small but okay, with closed shower area. No internet inside the room, but there's 2 free computers with internet in the reception area. As we only stayed for 1 night, it didn't matter at all. The reception area is clean, neat, and very much different to the outside. For check-in / check-out, the receptionist did the task efficiently and quick. This hotel is right next to the Eurolines bus station. Taxis are parking just outside the hotel. However, the nearest U-bahn or S-bahn takes about 10 minutes walk. If you arrived by train (Berlin Hbf) and has lotsa luggages, better take a taxi as it takes only 10 minutes away. We didn't take the breakfast at the hotel. Eating out in Berlin is quite cheap. Argentinian steak at the doorstep is okay for dinner. The location is not superb, but as I paid only 64 Eur for one night (a room for 3 adults, with air-con in the summertime), it was really value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good....Better if Wifi is available in the room and offcorse if it included in the room pacakage

Reviews.Title: “Doable But Chilly Room”
Reviews.Author: flyjournal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights from late November to early December 2010. I had a twin bedded room for a single person. It was below freezing temperatures in Berlin while I was there. Temperatures stayed in the minus range during that week ranging from minus 4 to minus 12 degrees Celsius . I paid 49 euros per night as I booked my stayed on Ibis's website. I chose this hotel as I arrived via long distance bus from Dresden & all I did was to roll my luggage for a few seconds & viola, I was at its doorstep. So if you arrive at ZOB Berlin Central Bus Terminal, this hotel is the most convenient. The room was huge and that is where the heating problem started. The radiator was the fan based type located high above, close to the ceiling. I turned it to the maximum temperature of 30 degrees Celsius and adjusted the the fan level to high. As the room was big, there were pockets of it that remained chilly especially close to the window area. Also there were no radiators in the bathroom, there was only a palm sized circular ventilation hole on the ceiling that released warm air which was NOT sufficient to warm the bathroom. I rather prefer the single or double pipe radiators that are attached to the walls rather than a fan based radiator as the room gets very very dry within a short period of time with a fan based radiator. Nevertheless, despite the heating issues, the room was quiet. Housekeeping was not up to par as I noticed that the WC was not cleaned properly when I checked in. Could have done a better job compared to the single room ensuite bathroom at A&O hostel I stayed in Dresden which was spotless. The best part of this Ibis Hotel was the free internet service provided in the reception area for hotel guests who did not bring along their laptops. The free internet service was extremely fast & reliable and can be accessed at any time of the day & night, 24/7. I did not partake in the breakfast service as I do not find it worth it. You can simply walk 3 minutes down to Kaiserdamm and there are several bakeries around there.

Reviews.Title: “All you need for Business”
Reviews.Author: Anja-Superlekker
Reviews.Content: Stay was a freebie so cannot comment on price. I saw a single cost 90EURO on the night I stayed and I'd probably pay that in another city altough in Berlin I'd rent a flat any time if I were paying myself. It is located on the busy Messedam with not much interesting around (except the International Conference Center) there is 2 U-Bahn stations, and a bus hub next door - I travelled to Kreuzberg the other end of town in 15-20min, and it only takes 20min to get to the airport taking 2 buses. So, okay for sightseeing, and a good night sleep is guaranteed with some very efficient German glazing - didn't hear a peep the 3 days I stayed there. It looks pretty awful and impersonal from the outside, but the reception and breakfast room the made an effort to make it look simple yet classy. Same goes for rooms - certainly a notch up from the moulded unit bathrooms and dated furniture I got so used to in ever-reliable Ibis. Rooms big enough, nice big desk facing window, new big-ish TV and up to date TV listings magazine, lovely comfortable bed (firm mattress and super clean bed linen). Very clean. Breakfast was nice, good choice of foods, nice quality food, fresh coffee. I'd highly recommend this for someone on business as it is very quiet, a nice environment to work in and you'll get a good nights sleep. Didn't try to connect to their WiFi as using mobile internet. Didn't try any other food but there's an Argentinian steakhouse and a Chinese restaurant in the building. IN a nutshell: It has all you need for a business trip if your expense account is small :)

Reviews.Title: “OK but expensive for the facilities (or lack of at the price)”
Reviews.Author: BumpsB
Reviews.Content: 190 Euros for a night? Not good value and was much more when we arrived than had been quoted on their website (whiuch would have been overpriced even at E109.00). Extra for internet, no free internet in reception as mentioned on website. Extra for breakfast! Their excuse for the sky high price? A busy time and prices go up for that. We saw about 20 other guests and it looked nearly empty. Staff were pleasant, everything was clean but no-one very interested when we complained. We did finally get a partial (25%) refund but only because a lump of metal fell off the wall in the night and woke us up - they were concerned about that at least. Not really a good location unless you were visiting the conference center - in which case book early and don't get ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “normal Ibis hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cuby12
Reviews.Content: A normal Ibis hotel like all the others. Definitely good equipped, looks new and clean. The rooms are rather small as normal in these hotels but for a night you have everything you need. for visiting hte fair perfectly located for sightseeing a little bit far away from town center. Needs couple of minutes to go to the Eastern part of the city. Staff was friendly but partly not enough for the crowded and busy hotel. Brekfast is expensive. internet not free :(

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful service”
Reviews.Author: erfreutwanderer
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to Berlin before but have not been since about 2004. This hotel, like all in the chain, was clean and comfortable. I find that all Ibis staff are helpful and go just a little bit out of their way to help. However, the staff here really went the extra mile (so to speak) to help me with the Berlin public transport system...which is excellent once you've cracked it. On previous visits to Berlin I was with friends with a car so I never had to deal with more complications than an Ubahn ride but this time it was different. \The staff spent time pouring over maps with me and explaining what the symbols meant ...they were just fantastic and the Ibis chain should be proud of such staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for tradeshow and conference visitors!”
Reviews.Author: Jmbreuer
Reviews.Content: The hotel has had a makeover in 2009 and is now a great hotel when you are visting a conference or a tradeshow in the Berlin Messe. It is located next to the Messe and just 20 minutes to Berlin Tegel Airport. The staff is friendly and helpfull. The rooms are basic with a good bed, spotless clean and the shower is very good! This hotel is value for money with a good breakfast with a view on the 8th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: PetrS2
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, clean! I recommend it for your stays in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “BASIC, CLEAN, GOOD FOR CONFERENCES AT ICC BERLIN”
Reviews.Author: follyfootfarm
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for its proximity to the ICC and this was great - just across the road. Clean basic hotel with strip lighting and OK breakfast, this was not a luxury stay by any means. Useful for UBahn, but taxis into town center cost around 15-20 euros. Area felt a bit spooky for two woman travellers. Use for ICC but stay more centrally for other visits. NOTE beware of main road side rooms - mine was incredibly noisy if I left the window open as I prefer to do.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended - top marks following renovation”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeElizabeth
Reviews.Content: Ibis Messe has just had a complete renovation. Room (flat screen TV, spotless bathroom, comfortable beds) faultless and tremendous value for money. Breakfast on 8th floor with panoramic views of Berlin, equally good value - cereals, muesli, fruit, cold meats, cheeses, eggs (scrambled and boiled), bread, rolls, croissants, fruit juices, fresh fruit. And kitchen staff kept the buffet well stocked to the end of the breakfast period. All staff spoke good English and were unfailingly helpful. Easy transport links from airport (Tegel only 20 min via X9 bus and rail). Elizabeth

Reviews.Title: “do not go there unless you really need to”
Reviews.Author: Limabre
Reviews.Content: The hotel is extremely basic, do not expect much. No room service, no minibar, and yuck, soap that other people have used, to save money. Also, people entered our room with the "do not disturb" sign on the door. Walls had spots and room smelled smokey. Do not go there unless you really need to. We had to pay to whole stay on the first night, otherwise we would have left early to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: chicochad
Reviews.Content: Good Location, Easy to find and free parking , was on 7th floor good views over Berlin clean and tidy hotel with nice bar. Easy to use the U Bahn .

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: yannes
Reviews.Content: In some countries, this hotel wouldn't be a two-star (as it is), but a four-star hotel! It's very clean and tidy, my room was spacious and really tastefully decorated, the bathroom was spotless. I loved the breakfast room at the top floor, which offered a spectacular view of the sunrise over Berlin! The staff hardly speaks English, but anyway, they are all really nice. It's quite far from the center of the city, but there's an U-bahn station nearby, it's about 30mins ride to Alexanderplatz, and it costs about 2EUR.

Reviews.Title: “Clean as a hospital”
Reviews.Author: Oscar_from_Denmark
Reviews.Content: This is one of the cleanest hotels I ever stayed in. A)Good bed. B)Very good breakfast (eat all you can for 9 euros) C)Very quiet. D)The staff was friendly. E)The temprature in the room was fine(I stayed in december!) I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting something simple but incredibly clean and at reasonable price (69 euros for a room). The only thing I could complain a tiny little bit is that it is not placed in the middle of the city. The nearest underground station is about 200 meters from the hotel but in 10 minutes you are there were the center of the city starts. Hope this review helps you take a good decision! :-)

HotelInfo.Name: Ibis Berlin Messe
HotelInfo.Address: Messedamm 10, 14057 Berlin, Germany
